synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blunt Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, along with guest Garrett, dive deep into the complexities of body image and the gym. They share personal experiences and insights on navigating societal pressures, self-acceptance, and the importance of finding joy in fitness, all while maintaining a light-hearted and humorous atmosphere.
quotes: To accept yourself, you must get to the root cause of why you have a negative self-image.
Comparison is the thief of joy.
If you're going to the gym to improve the way you look, you should also be going because it's something you enjoy.
Everyone is trying their best; you shouldn't be going around telling people what to do.
Drink more water; it can change your life.
The strongest people in the gym are usually the nicest.
If you want to make a change, it should come from a positive place, not a negative one.
You can get results without going to the gym; just find something active that you love.
Don't be afraid to talk about your relationship with your body; it can be a huge relief.
Your body image should reflect who you are, not who society says you should be.
